title: Beck climate map
description: Global Köppen-Geiger climate classification at a 1-km resolution for the present-day (1980–2016) and for projected future conditions (2071–2100) under climate change
contents:
Details


The present-day map is derived from an ensemble of four high-resolution, topographically-corrected climatic maps. The future map is derived from an ensemble of 32 climate model projections (scenario RCP8.5), by superimposing the projected climate change anomaly on the baseline high-resolution climatic maps. For both time periods we calculate confidence levels from the ensemble spread, providing valuable indications of the reliability of the classifications. The new maps exhibit a higher classification accuracy and substantially more detail than previous maps, particularly in regions with sharp spatial or elevation gradients. The new maps including the associated confidence maps are freely available via www.gloh2o.org/koppen.

title: CCI Land Cover
description: 27 years of global Land cover data (1992-2018) provided by the European Space Agency (ESA) with a resolution of 0.028-degree (~300-m at the equator)
contents:
Details


As part of the Climate Change Initiative (CCI) promoted by ESA, this is the first, mid-resolution dataset of its kind to cover nearly three decades. As a consequence, it offers an important basis for for continuous change detection and monitoring. While initially produced as an Essential Climate Variable (ECV) and a basis for climate modeling, it has been used in other applications (e.g. ecology, land use science) depicting its wide applicability. You can explore this dataset through a decidated viewer a dedicated viewer.

title: GLobal surface water
description: Multi-temporal dynamics of Global Surface Water (GSW), mapped at a 30-m resolution by the European Joint Research Centre (JRC)
contents:
Details


GSW is a unique dataset, offering a global, yearly classifcation of seasonal and permanent water. The original dataset is provided at a 30-m resolution, and information on how to access it can be found at at the JRC’s website At the MAS lab, we aggregated this data product to 300-m, deriving per-pixel percentage cover data for permanent and seasonal water, as well as missing data.
